sen.j: 河合鉄五郎（かわい てつごろう、弘化3年（1846年） - ?）は、国厚見郡岐阜七曲町出身の貫義隊隊士。
sen.e: Tetsugoro KAWAI (1846 - ?) was a member of Kangi-tai from Gifu Nanamagaricho Town, Atsumi District, Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 「国厚見郡」は「美濃国厚見郡」の誤植と判断しました。「岐阜七曲町」読み方不明です。
sen.e: Tetsugoro KAWAI (1846 - ?) was a member of Kangi-tai from Gifu Nanamagaricho Town, Atsumi-gun County.
sen.cmt: 指示書に、あえてそのままの内容で翻訳するようにとありましたので、Atsumi-gun としました。「岐阜七曲町」は読み方不明です。
sen.e: Tetsugoro KAWAI (1846 - ?) was a member of Kangi-tai from Gifu Nanamagaricho Town, Atsumi County.
Later, he joined Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
Later, he joined Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: joined の前のスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Later, he joined Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).

sen.j: 戊辰戦争が勃発した際、松平兵庫頭率いる貫義隊に入隊して江戸を脱走。
sen.e: When the Boshin War broke out, he joined Kangi-tai led by Hyogonokami Matsudaira and run away from Edo.
When the Boshin War broke out, he joined Kangi-tai led by Hyogonokami Matsudaira and run away from Edo.
When the Boshin War broke out, he joined Kangi-tai led by Hyogonokami Matsudaira and run away from Edo.

sen.j: 会津で山口二郎（斎藤一）率いる新選組に入隊し、如来堂の戦いで離散。
sen.e: He joined Shinsengumi led by Jiro YAMAGUCHI (Hajime SAITO) in Aizu but broke up in the Battle of Nyoraido.
He joined Shinsengumi led by Jiro YAMAGUCHI (Hajime SAITO) in Aizu but broke up in the Battle of Nyoraido.
He joined Shinsengumi led by Jiro YAMAGUCHI (Hajime SAITO) in Aizu but broke up in the Battle of Nyoraido.

sen.j: 久米部正親らと共に敗走を続け、明治元年（1868年）10月5日に銚子市で新政府軍に降伏した。
sen.e: He kept being routed with Masachika KUMEBE and others, and surrendered to the New government army in Choshi City on November 18, 1868.
He kept being routed with Masachika KUMEBE and others, and surrendered to the new government army in Choshi City on November 18, 1868.
sen.cmt: New を new に変更しました。
sen.e: He kept being routed with Masachika KUMEBE and others, and surrendered to the new government army in Choshi City on November 18, 1868.
